dt: {bc}to prove or serve to prove to be real, true, or genuine

pt: {sc}confirm{/sc} {sc}corroborate{/sc} {sc}substantiate{/sc} {sc}verify{/sc} {sc}authenticate{/sc} {sc}validate{/sc} mean to attest to the truth or validity of something. {sc}confirm{/sc} implies the removing of doubts by an authoritative statement or indisputable fact.
{sc}corroborate{/sc} suggests the strengthening of what is already partly established.
{sc}substantiate{/sc} implies the offering of evidence that sustains the contention.

pt.t: the claims have yet to be {it}substantiated{/it}

pt: {sc}verify{/sc} implies the establishing of correspondence of actual facts or details with those proposed or guessed at.

pt.t: all statements of fact in the article have been {it}verified{/it}

pt: {sc}authenticate{/sc} implies establishing genuineness by adducing legal or official documents or expert opinion.
{sc}validate{/sc} implies establishing validity by authoritative affirmation or by factual proof.

shortdef: to prove or serve to prove to be real, true, or genuine
